subject: Tests and Testing
Steroids
Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: The administrator of Nascar’s drug-testing program said he told the driver Jeremy Mayfield what banned substance was found in his positive test. Dr. David Black said he has had several conversations with Mayfield since his suspension on May 8 and has explicitly explained the test results. On Saturday, Mayfield said he was never told what he tested positive for, and has yet to receive a copy of his results. He maintains his positive result is from mixing a prescription drug with the allergy medication Claritin-D, an explanation Black has strongly rejected.
